oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Limit cycles for a class of $\mathbb{Z}_{2n}-$equivariant systems without infinite equilibria
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Labouriau, Isabel S.
Murza, Adrian C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Dynamical Systems
34C07
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We analyze the dynamics of a class of $\mathbb{Z}_{2n}$-equivariant differential equations on the plane, depending on 4 real parameters. This study is the generalisation to $\mathbb{Z}_{2n}$ of previous works with $\mathbb{Z}_4$ and $\mathbb{Z}_6$ symmetry. We reduce the problem of finding limit cycles to an Abel equation, and provide criteria for proving in some cases uniqueness and hyperbolicity of the limit cycle that surrounds either 1, $2n+1$ or $4n+1$ equilibria, the origin being always one of these points.
